intro: Machaerium intermedium, commonly known as the slender machaerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, arranged in dense, branched inflorescences. Machaerium intermedium is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and forest edges.
